title: Augusta County: A. J. Gilkeson to Gilkeson's brother (probably Hugh Gilkeson), July 31, 1865
summary: Gilkeson recounts the details of his father's death. He goes on to give further updates about his family's health. He also ponders the postwar conditions, as he discusses mail service and the status of banks.
keywords: Death/Casualties, Family, Home Front, American Civil War
